question: Which of the following is the correct order of states/UTs for their per hectare carbon stock?
option1: Arunachal Pradesh> Andaman & Nicobar Islands> Chhattisgarh> Madhya Pradesh
option2: Andaman & Nicobar Islands> Arunachal Pradesh> Sikkim> Karnataka
option4: Madhya Pradesh> Chhattisgarh> Arunachal Pradesh> Maharashtra
answer: Andaman & Nicobar Islands> Arunachal Pradesh> Sikkim> Karnataka
explanation: As per the Indian State of Forest Report 2017, the total carbon stock is estimated to be 7083 million tonnes. Soil Organic Carbon (SOC) is the largest pool of carbon followed by Above Ground Biomass (AGB), Below Ground Biomass (BGB), Litter and dead wood The report shows that the per hectare carbon stock of different states/UTs as Andaman & Nicobar Islands (170.68 tonnes) with highest carbon stock per hectare, followed by Arunachal Pradesh (148.52 tonnes), Sikkim (145.14 tonnes) and Karnataka (126.52 tonnes).
